question.text: Many diseases can be diagnosed by observing the symptoms in the patient. Which group of symptoms are indicative of pneumonia?

options.text: Difficulty in respiration, fever, chills, cough, headache
Constipation, abdominal pain, cramps, blood clots
Nasal congestion and discharge, cough, sore throat, headache
High fever, weakness, stomach pain, loss of appetite and constipation.

solution.text: Pneumonia is an inflammatory disorder of lungs. It causes inflammation of Alveoli. It is bacterial or viral in origin. It mainly affects respiratory system. Thus some symptoms can give us an idea about this disease. (Symptoms are conditions described by the patient and Signs are conditions noticed by the Doctors). Difficulty is respiration and cough gives us an idea that respiratory system is affected. Fever, chills, headache explain that body has an infection may be an inflammation. Thus these symptoms can help to diagnose the pneumonia condition.
